isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - DOOR WINDOW REGULATOR - MANUAL OR ELECTRIC

svcproc.title: DOOR WINDOW REGULATOR - MANUAL OR ELECTRIC

svcprocinfo.para: The cab door window regulator assembly (Item 1, Figure 35) is serviced as a complete unit with the door glass either in place or removed. If it is not desired or necessary to replace door glass, simply lower glass sufficiently to remove regulator lever roller from window guide (Item 3, Figure 28) and then push glass back up into window frame. Secure glass temporarily to top of door with tape.

step1.para: Remove door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Remove.

Temporarily install window regulator handle (Item 5, Figure 32). Lower window glass to access opening (Item 3, Figure 27) at bottom of door and remove the two fastener screws (Item 5, Figure 28) from glass and window guide (Items 2 and 3, Figure 28).
Remove window guide by sliding it from window regulator lever roller (Items 3 and 1, Figure 28).
Push door glass up in window frame and secure glass to top of door with tape. Remove the window regulator handle (Item 5, Figure 32)
Remove the four retaining screws (Item 3, Figure 36) which hold the window regulator assembly (Item 2, Figure 36) in the door.

step1.para: Push regulator shaft through hole in door inner panel and remove window regulator assembly through access opening (Item 2, Figure 35)

svcsubproc.title: Install

caution.para: Be careful when re-installing door glass, door window regulator and related parts to avoid glass breakage. Door glass inner and outer seals, channel seals and glass mounting fasteners have been designed to protect glass through rugged operating conditions. Make sure the reassembly of these parts will maintain the same glass protection.

step1.para: Position window regulator assembly (Item 1, Figure 35) in door through access opening (Item 2, Figure 36). Push regulator handle shaft through hole in door inner panel. Secure with four retaining screws (Item 3, Figure 36) and tighten until snug.

note.para: Electrically operated windows, regulator and motor are considered one unit. The motor is not replaced separately.

step1.para: Lubricate cab door window regulator gear teeth, window regulator lever roller and window guide at installation. Use Lubriplate 105 lubricant or equivalent ( Figure 36).
Remove tape from window glass and lower glass down to access opening.
Slide window guide (Item 3, Figure 28) in place on window regulator lever roller (Item 1, Figure 28)

Position the window guide and window regulator lever (Items 3 and 1, Figure 28) onto glass and secure with fastener screws (Item 5, Figure 28), then raise glass. Refer to Figure 31for fastener screw assembly.

svcsubproc.para: Install door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Install.
